etymology.description: 斯(斯) (sī, "this") is often used as a phonetic representation in transliterated names. 蒂(蒂) (dì, "stem") and 芬(芬) (fēn, "perfume; fragrance") are also used for phonetic matching in transliterations, rather than their literal meanings.
etymology.interpretation: 斯蒂芬 is a transliteration of the Western name 'Stephen.' The choice of characters is based on their phonetic similarity to the original name, rather than their individual meanings.

examples.chinese: 我的朋友叫斯蒂芬(我的朋友叫斯蒂芬)。
斯蒂芬是一位优秀的作家(斯蒂芬是一位優秀的作家)，他的小说横扫全球(他的小說橫掃全球)。
examples.pinyin: Sīdìfēn shì yī wèi yōuxiù de zuòjiā, tā de xiǎoshuō héngsǎo quánqiú.
examples.english: Stephen is an outstanding writer, and his novels have taken the world by storm.

examples.chinese: 在纽约(在紐約)，斯蒂芬出演了著名话剧(斯蒂芬出演了著名話劇)。
examples.pinyin: Zài Niǔyuē, Sīdìfēn chūyǎnle zhùmíng huàjù.
examples.english: In New York, Stephen starred in a famous play.
